meanings.definition: relating to the fundus of a hollow organ
meanings.sent1: The fundic area of the stomach is where digestion begins.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the fundic region of the patient's stomach.
meanings.sent3: The fundic part of the intestine seemed to be the most popular spot for food.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed in the fundic chamber of his heart.
meanings.sent5: The fundic layer of the organ was vibrant and full of life.

meanings.definition: pertaining to a fundus or bottom
meanings.sent1: The fundic depth of the well was unknown.
meanings.sent2: The diver explored the fundic depths of the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The fundic level of the lake was perfect for swimming.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts reached the fundic base of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The fundic portion of the building was the strongest and most stable.

meanings.definition: of or relating to a fundus
meanings.sent1: The fundic curvature of the eye was fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the fundic shape of the vase perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The fundic design of the room gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a fundic resonance that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The fundic structure of the building provided great support.
